result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Don Ternail Bush

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Don Ternail Bush appeared by video.  Attorney Matt Ricci appeared by video for Don Ternail Bush.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel requests bail review hearing.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Don Ternail Bush in court with attorney Matt Ricci.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Benjamin Ade, Milwaukee Police Department Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 41.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Attorney Matt Ricci in court.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for preliminary hearing. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing. Case adjourned to Branch 35. Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Don Ternail Bush in court in person with Attorney Matt Ricci who appears by video.  Thomas L. Potter appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. Defense moves to dismiss; motion is taken under advisement. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Br 35.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR. 35
Defendant Don Ternail Bush in court appear by video.  Annie Louk appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court reminds defendant of conditions of No Contact Order.
Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Branch 35, Judge Rosa.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Don Ternail Bush in court.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Don Ternail Bush appeared by video means.
Matter in court for Preliminary hearing. SPD needs more time to appoint representation. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CLW, LCP, CB, JAR and MJ
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO JUSTICE POINT LEVEL 5 for supervision. Defendant to report to JUSTICE POINT.
IF THE DEFENDANT FAILS TO REPORT A WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Don Ternail Bush in court with attorney Ashley Fard.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
K-Warrant
